name: Seafood Scampi Linguine
author: DONNA123
summary: This is my own special recipe. The most requested dinner when friends and family come to visit from all over the country. It's so easy and trust me...I hate capers, but they add just the right flavor.  If you really don't like capers, put them in a empty tea bag, fasten with a twist tie and throw it away before serving, but trust me I've had no complaints! This is a perfect dinner to entertain with or just for a romantic night for two. Suggestion: Have a nice but simple spinach salad and a good gourmet Italian bread with it.
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds clams in shell, scrubbed
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Melt butter in a large heavy skillet
Add red pepper, zucchini, garlic, and shallots
Saute over high heat until the shallots begin to soften; about 4 minutes
Mix in capers, salt and pepper
Remove from heat and add clams and shrimp
Transfer mixture to a large baking dish
Cover and bake in a preheated oven until the clams have all opened and shrimp is cooked
Make sure the lid is not touching the shrimp or they'll burn and stick
Cook about 20 to 25 minutes, stirring occasionally
Pour the scampi over the linguine, top with fresh basil and serve
